The image used in the claim was traced b: which was part of a campaign to sell off a collection of vintage cars owned by French transport entrepreneur Roger Baillon.
The claim falsely attributed the cars to: s ex-senate president, Dr. Nwafor Orizu, who was the first post-independence senate president and acting president from 1965 to 1966. However, there is no connection between Orizu and the cars.
The Facebook page George Udom: which shared the post, has a history of publishing misinformation, as confirmed by AFP Fact Check.
